comment: A little weak/watered down but better than tonight’s aperitifs.
Dusty walnuts, wax, lanolin, and sawdust make up the majority of the experience, with a smattering of light sherry cask characteristics adding some sweetness as a background

Palate- Vanilla, Raisins, hint of peat that disappears instantaneously
Finish- Is not fantastic, one cube makes the finish much smoother
I bought it directly at the distillery. It is interesting! The taste is well balanced between wood and floral/herbal. Lightly smoky not peaty. for my taste, it is a good one.

Wowza! This is delicious, and very much resembles the Glenlivet Nadurra First Fill, though at a lower ABV. Pears and faint flowers to the nose, with the palate adding an additional layer of wood. The body is oily with a smooth finish. Recommend!
